newsitem.title: USA: CBS not being sold to Microsoft - CBS official.
newsitem.headline: CBS not being sold to Microsoft - CBS official.

text.p: Westinghouse Electric Corp is not looking to sell its CBS media business to Microsoft Corp, a top CBS official said Tuesday.
The New York Post reported on Tuesday that Microsoft was reviewing the finances of Westinghouse's CBS unit and was considering making a bid to buy the network.
"I can say no, there isn't anything to (the story)," said the executive, who declined to be identified. ""We're not selling it. We're building it."
A CBS spokesman declined to comment. "We don't respond to rumors and speculation," the spokesman said.
Westinghouse is in the midst of preparing to split its media and industrial businesses into two companies. The split is expected in late September or early October.
The newspaper, quoting sources close to the situation, said four Microsoft executives were reviewing CBS finances.
Microsoft was not immediately available for comment.
The newspaper reported that Seagram Co Ltd "is also said to be looking at CBS." A spokesman at Seagram, which owns Universal Studios, declined to comment.
The Microsoft and Seagram interest in CBS was said to be preliminary and it was not clear if offers would be made, the Post said.
